ResourceHeader.Description:
SHARP Near Real Time data in the Cylindrical Equal Area (CEA) Cartesian coordinate.
SHARP stands for Space-weather HMI Active Region Patch. A SHARP is a DRMS series that contains (1) various space-weather quantities calculated from the photospheric vector magnetogram data and stored as FITS header keywords, and (2) 31 data segments (described in detail below), including each component of the vector magnetic field, the line-of-sight magnetic field, continuum intensity, doppler velocity, error maps and bitmaps. The data segments are not full-disk; rather, they are partial-disk, automatically-identified active region patches. SHARPs are calculated every 12 minutes. Often, there is more than one active region on the solar disk at any given time. Thus, SHARPs are indexed by two prime keys: time, T_REC, and HMI Active Region Patch Number, HARPNUM.
The hmi.sharp_720s_cea_nrt and hmi.sharp_cea_720s data have been projected and remapped to a Cylindrical Equal Area (CEA) Cartesian coordinate system centered on the tracked active region. The size of the nrt regions will evolve with time. At each time step the definitive SHARPs will enclose the maximum extent of the region during it's disk passage. The three prime vector components are Bx, By, and Bz. HARP maps of 8 additional quantities are also provided at each time step: the three estimated component errors, the line-of-sight magnetogram, a Dopplergram, the continuum intensity, a map of the active pixels, and an estimate of the confidence in the disambiguation.

Parameter.Name: USFLUX in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Total unsigned flux

Parameter.Name: MEANGAM in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Mean inclination angle, gamma

Parameter.Name: MEANGBT in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Mean value of the total field gradient

Parameter.Name: MEANGBZ in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Mean value of the vertical field gradient

Parameter.Name: MEANGBH in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Mean value of the horizontal field gradient

Parameter.Name: MEANJZD in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Mean vertical current density

Parameter.Name: TOTUSJZ in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Total unsigned vertical current

Parameter.Name: MEANALP in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Mean current helicity

Parameter.Name: TOTUSJH in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Total unsigned current helicity

Parameter.Name: ABSNJZH in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Absolute value of the net current helicity

Parameter.Name: SAVNCPP in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Sum of the Absolute Value of the Net Currents Per Polarity

Parameter.Name: MEANPOT in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Mean photospheric excess magnetic energy density

Parameter.Name: TOTPOT in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Total photospheric magnetic energy density

Parameter.Name: SHRGT45 in the FITS Header
Parameter.Description: Percentage of pixels with a mean shear angle greater than 45 degrees

Parameter.Name: MAGNETOGRAM
Parameter.Description:
The magnetogram segment contains HARP-sized line-of-sight magnetogram data from the DRMS series hmi.M_720s.
CEA version: the field is remapped, but not projected, i.e. it is still the line-of-sight component relative to HMI.

Parameter.Name: BITMAP
Parameter.Description:
The bitmap segment identifies the pixels located within the smooth bounding curve by labeling each pixel with the following: 1 : weak field outside smooth bounding curve 2 : strong field outside smooth bounding curve 33 : weak field inside smooth bounding curve 34 : strong field inside smooth bounding curve
CEA version: same.

Parameter.Name: DOPPLERGRAM
Parameter.Description:
The dopplergram segment contains HARP-sized dopplergram data from the DRMS series hmi.V_720s.
CEA version: the Doppler velocity is remapped, but not projected, i.e. it is still the line-of-sight component relative to HMI.

Parameter.Name: CONTINUUM
Parameter.Description:
The dopplergram segment contains HARP-sized dopplergram data from the DRMS series hmi.Ic_720s.
CEA Version: same.

Parameter.Name: CONFID_MAP
Parameter.Description: The confid_map segment identifies the confidence index of the inversion output. The index value at each pixel will take the integer value from 0 (best) to 6(worst), defined as the highest item number satisfying the following conditions: 0: No issue found in the input Stokes 1: Signals for the transverse field component in the input Stokes parameters (Q & U) were weak. 2: Signal for the line-of-sight field component in the input Stokes parameters (V) was weak. 3: Magnetic field signals of both LoS and transverse component were weak. 4: The ME-VFISV iteration did not converge within the iteration maximum. In the test data release, we set very small , thus, the confidence Îµ index at most pixels may be 4. 5: If the difference between the absolute value of the line-of-sight field strength derived from magnetogram algorithm and the absolute value of the LoS component from VFISV inversion |B cos(inclination)| is greater than 500 Gauss, we regard the inversion did not well solve the problem. 6: One (or more) of the 24 input Stokes arrays had NaN value.

Parameter.Name: Bp
Parameter.Description: Phi (westward) component of the CEA vector magnetic field.

Parameter.Name: Bt
Parameter.Description: Theta (southward) component of the CEA vector magnetic field.

Parameter.Name: Br
Parameter.Description: Radial (out of photosphere) component of the CEA vector magnetic field.
